title: Project Gallery section for Maa Sharada Construction single-page site

requirements.summary: Add a new Project Gallery section on the homepage with a responsive photo grid and in-page image preview modal.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section is rendered on the homepage between Services and Contact (or another clearly intentional placement) and uses a stable section id (e.g., id="gallery") so it can be navigated via scroll.
The gallery displays at least 6 project images in a responsive grid (1 column on small screens, increasing on larger breakpoints).
Clicking/tapping an image opens an in-page preview (modal/dialog or equivalent) with the larger image and a close control; ESC closes the preview.
All images have meaningful alt text and do not break layout while loading (use fixed aspect ratio containers and object-fit).
All gallery image src paths are relative and compatible with IC deployment (consistent with existing "./assets/generated/..." usage).

file_operations.description: Create a new ProjectGallerySection component rendering a themed section with id="gallery", heading + short description, and a responsive grid of 6 images. Use fixed-aspect-ratio containers with object-fit to prevent layout shifts while loading; implement an in-page preview modal with overlay + close button and ESC-to-close behavior. Ensure image src values use relative paths consistent with the site (e.g., ./assets/generated/...). Use shadcn-ui Card/Button styling patterns already used in the site to match theme. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new ProjectGallerySection into the single-page layout between ServicesSection and ContactSection (or other clearly intentional placement) so it appears on the homepage and can be reached by scroll navigation.

requirements.summary: Update header and footer navigation to include smooth-scroll links to the Project Gallery section and preserve existing mobile drawer close behavior and header offset handling.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation includes a new item that scrolls smoothly to the gallery section and closes the mobile drawer after selection (matching existing behavior).
Footer “Quick Links” includes a new link/button that scrolls smoothly to the gallery section (matching existing behavior).
After navigation to the gallery, the section heading is not hidden behind the sticky header (existing scroll-margin behavior continues to apply).

file_operations.description: Add a new nav item for the gallery section (id "gallery") to both desktop and mobile navigation lists, using the existing smooth-scroll helper and ensuring the mobile drawer closes after selection (existing behavior).
Add a new Footer Quick Link that smooth-scrolls to the gallery section (id "gallery") using the existing scrollToSection behavior.

Ensure the gallery section heading is not hidden behind the sticky header after smooth-scroll by applying an appropriate scroll-margin-top utility/class consistent with other sections’ behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Match the new Project Gallery section styling to the existing construction-themed design system and prevent regressions across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: Gallery section styling is consistent with the existing construction-themed design system (Tailwind tokens, border/shadow patterns similar to other sections).
The section includes a clear heading and short description consistent with other sections’ structure and spacing.
No regressions to existing sections (Hero, Services, Contact, Footer) and the page remains visually coherent end-to-end.

file_operations.description: Align spacing, typography, card borders/shadows, and hover states with existing sections (e.g., Services/Contact card patterns and hover shadow-construction). Ensure the section layout looks good on mobile/desktop and integrates coherently with surrounding sections. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust section ordering/spacing only as needed to keep the overall page visually coherent after inserting the new gallery section (no content changes to existing sections).
